data.title: Listening Loft Store
data.meta_description: Smooth Global Living - A Vision of SmoothJazz.com since 2000.
data.text:

The Playlist

Terence Young Music

Search Artist Name

Listening Loft : HOTPICKS

Sylvia Bennett

Amazing LoveOut of Sight Music

Over the course of her 35+ year career, versatile Grammy-nominated jazz songstress and songwriter Sylvia Bennett has collaborated with an ongoing flow of greats, from Lionel Hampton (who once exclaimed, “Man, that lady can sing!”), Rick Braun and Paul Brown to Nathan East and Arturo Sandoval. Her colorful parade of guests continues on AMAZING LOVE, which is dedicated to her late husband of 50+ years, Dr. Hal. This set finds her swaying and swinging through a batch of charming, romantically inclined pop/jazz tunes for different moods of a relationship. She enters into divine duet partnerships with violinist Peter Ferencz of The Peet Project, bassist Brendan Rothwell, saxophonist Ed Calle, and SmoothJazz.com founder, Sandy Shore delivers the “Shore Mix” of the title track. The lovefest extends to her trad jazz arrangement of the French version of the song better known as “Beyond The Sea.”

Mike Di Lorenzo

Don't Let GoKeep The Groove

After an early career performing at classic NYC venues (Carnegie Hall, Madison Square Garden, The Apollo), working with the likes of Cissy and Whitney Houston and touring with everyone from Gerald Alston to Bo Diddley, NY/NJ based keyboardist/composer Mike Di Lorenzo is quickly closing in on 20 years as an acclaimed instrumental artist. He drops an inspiring and exciting first single from his upcoming full-length, follow-up to his 2023 album PLAY IT COOL with his latest single “Don’t Let Go.” It’s a hip, edgy symphonic jazz romp blending his melodic and improvisational piano magic with soaring synth textures, the punchy emotional soloing of saxophonist Frank Elmo and subtle vocal embellishments by Sonna Rele, who will be prominently featured on the album!

Nathan and Noah East

YesterdayEastern Star

Ten years after Noah East, bassist Nathan East’s son, made his recording debut in a duet of “Yesterday” with his legendary dad on Nathan’s Grammy nominated self-titled solo album, the duo returns with a completely re-imagined version of the Beatles classic. Since that time, Noah, now 24, has been following closely in the footsteps of Nathan, a longtime member of contemporary jazz supergroup Fourplay as well as Eric Clapton’s band, and has appeared on thousands of recordings. The younger East has established himself as an in-demand touring and session pianist and organist, with performances in Europe, Japan and the U.S. While their original take on “Yesterday” featured Noah’s exquisite piano work and Nathan’s breezy vocals, this new twist from the forthcoming FATHER SONG debut album, offers a slow-simmering, bluesy instrumental highlighting stellar organ mastery, with trademark Nathan East solo improvisation.

Vincent Ingala

Escape With MeShanachie Entertainment

Seems like not long ago, Vincent Ingala was Smooth Jazz’s upcoming teen sensation – and suddenly, he’s a 30something core genre artist with 15 #1 Billboard hits, including the 2023 Airplay Song of the Year. With the drop of his sultry and elegant yet often electrifying, ultra-eclectic 8th album ESCAPE WITH ME, the composer, saxophonist and multi-instrumentalist is gunning for a bunch more. Though his bright, infectious originals, including a seductive, keyboard ballad, are hard to top, it’s testament to the timelessness of his style – and love for jazz, pop, R&B and dance music – that the set includes re-imaginings of both a magnificent 60’s Delfonics ballad and a thumpin’ late 90s spin on an Ultra Nate #1 dance hit featuring the soaring guest vocals of Lindsey Webster.

Jarez

Coming Back AroundJ Star Entertainment LLC

Once best known for his tours with the late rapper Coolio and appearances on the popular web series “Cookin’ With Coolio,” multi-faceted saxophonist Jarez is now all about embodying his identity as a solo artist, Mayor of J Funk City. That’s also the name of his 2020 album that made him the first indie saxman to hit #1 on all SmoothJazz.com Charts simultaneously. He rules the town once again with his latest single “Coming Back Around,” a summery, high-octane party jam that marks his second off the chain collaboration with bassist Julian Vaughn. Building on their well-established chemistry, the two up their synergistic game with sass and fire, creating a powerful duality throughout while offering several dazzling solo spotlights by both.

Reza Khan

MysticalPainted Media LLC

Over the course of his multi-faceted 15-year recording career, Reza Khan has enjoyed several radio friendly Smooth Jazz hits, including one with Nils. Yet the Bangladesh-born, NYC based composer/guitarist’s unique, freewheeling stylistic fusion includes elements of pop, jazz, soul and global influences. His world jazz guitar vibe comes to full creative fruition on the perfectly titled MYSTICAL, which finds him and longtime co-writer, arranger and producer, saxophonist David Mann, imagining a magical album featuring infectious pieces written with specific contemporary jazz greats in mind. Khan’s incredible skills as a musician and magnetism as a studio visionary attracted a dream guest list that includes Bob James, Jimmy Haslip, Philippe Saisse, Mark Egan, Jeff Lorber and Keiko Matsui – who join with Khan to create special collaborations for the ages.

Jeff Logan

IndigoFire & Ice Entertainment Network

When keyboardist/composer Jeff Logan first reached out to Paul Brown, the Grammy-winning hitmaker was first intrigued by the decades Logan had toiled as a corrections officer while developing his craft. When Brown heard his graceful and infectious, radio friendly compositions and lively piano style, he signed on to produce one song, which quickly evolved into Logan’s new album INDIGO, a tour-de-force collaboration that strikes Smooth Jazz gold. While showcasing Logan’s fresh, ultra-melodic touch on the piano and exciting sense of improvisation, the 10 fanciful, romantically inclined tracks create a dazzling, lightly funky flow that puts a hip, modern twist on a classic contemporary jazz piano sound that may remind listeners of classic tracks by David Benoit, Brian Culbertson and Gregg Karukas.

Al Nesbitt and The Alchemy

A Million Shiny ThingsMad Hat Fat Lip

Since opening 95 years ago, the legendary Chateau Marmont on Sunset Strip has been a beloved retreat for Hollywood creatives craving a temporary home away from the prying eyes of the public and press. With his new four-piece ensemble Al Nesbitt and the Alchemy, the multi-faceted, flamenco rock-driven, veteran acoustic guitarist – who recently scored a profile in Guitar World Magazine-Online – finds a fresh and exciting musical way to explore the rich history of the historic landmark. Fusing his snappy exotic style – influenced by everyone from John McLaughlin to Vicente Amigo – with his passions for film composers like Nicholas Hooper, Hanz Zimmer and Alexandre Desplat, Nesbitt creates an epic journey through time fueled by moody, film noir-inspired jazz and funky, symphonic rock jams.

Steve Oliver

A New LightWide Sky Records

After releasing ILLUMINATE in 2018, Steve Oliver engaged in some cool side projects, including a popular duet album with Brian Simpson and a set of acoustic re-imaginings of his greatest hits. Now, the prolific Smooth Jazz hitmaker a journalist once called “musical Disneyland” (for his sunny personality and composing style) is back in snappy, melodic and sonically adventurous radio-friendly mode with A NEW LIGHT. Perfectly in line with his other instantly infectious albums with similarly light-bearing titles, the collection – co-produced by genre mega-hitmaker Michael Broening – offers a blend of funky-breezy drive time jams, gently caressing ballads (one featuring saxman Jeff Kashiwa) and exciting dashes of percussive exotica featuring the one-two punch of his dynamic strings and trademark dreamy wordless and percussive vocals.

Shawn Raiford

The Next StepShawn Raiford Sax Productions

Calling to mind the title of sax man’s Shawn Raiford’s critically praised 2020 debut album, MAN WITH A HORN… While many may call themselves ‘men (or women) with horns, few know what to do with it to create the magic and make an emotional connection! Raiford, who’s been sharing his vibrant and adventurous horn-fire with fans in and around his home base in California for years, continues his breakthrough hot streak by following his recent, top-charting single, a sassy and brassy twist on Silk Sonic’s #1 multi-Grammy winning smash, “Leave the Door Open,” with his 3rd pre-release single, “Vallejo,” from his forthcoming album THE NEXT STEP. This jazzy nod to the original East San Francisco Bay Area hip hop scene sound, pioneered by Mac Dre and E-40 promises to propel Mr. Raiford further into Smooth Jazz star status! Becoming well-known for his live performances, the artist packs his rich, pure, dynamic tones into an entertaining, muscular delivery making for exciting concert productions featuring this supernova.

Rainforest Band

Good MedicineSan Francisco Records

With the release of GOOD MEDICINE, an inviting mix of spirited contemporary jazz, robust funk and sensual balladry, six-piece Bay Area ensemble Rainforest Band confirms its status as one of Smooth Jazz’s most environmentally conscious artists. Launched in 2017 by R&B/Gospel soul veterans Tony Saunders (bass), Vernon “Ice” Black (guitar) and Sylvester Burks (keyboards), the group refashions the eco-minded aesthetic of BLUES FROM THE RAINFOREST – A MUSICAL SUITE, an early 90s “environmental earth music album” created by Saunders’ father, famed keyboardist Merl Saunders, and the legendary Jerry Garcia. While the soaring power and passion of saxophonist Dave Ellis ensures that this collection is more horn-centric than their debut, there’s also plenty of urban jazz and groovin’ soul from Saunders and tasty, melodic guitar magic from Black and Lorn Leber. GOOD MEDICINE will make you feel good!

Paolo Rustichelli

Tempus FugitNext Age Music

Following the tremendous success of 2023’s “Love Divine” featuring the iconic Miles Davis posthumously, the father of chillout music and Smooth Jazz pioneer Paolo Rustichelli returns with a sexy summer gem and a new guest, sax star Jessy J. The title track to his soon to be released album, “Tempus Fugit” literally translates to “Time Flies.” Yet, it also stands still and traverses back and forth in our minds and here we are, always in the present moment! The non-linear thinking musician delivers a song that borrows musical ideas from the past and present and all the while innovates the future. Press play, turn up “Tempus Fugit” and dance in the moment, reminisce about the past, or plan for the future… This song will allow you to experience all of the above at the same time!

Tony Saunders

The Romance ContinuesBaja/TSR Records

True to the title of his 2011 debut album ROMANCING THE BASS, Tony Saunders once said, “I romance the bass like I romance life.” Over a decade later, the two-time Emmy winning Bay Area musician, composer, arranger and producer – who’s worked with everyone from Eric Clapton and David Crosby to Joe Sample and Chaka Khan - keeps the love for his instrument flowing and poppin’ with sensuality, funk and great adventure on THE ROMANCE CONTINUES. Co-produced by Grammy-winner Michael Mani, the effervescent bass melodies are at the forefront while complementing them with keys, sax and trumpet, as Saunders dives into the many musical loves of his life – jazz, gospel, R&B, rock and Latin music – while passionately covering Whitney Houston and paying homage to his late dad, renowned keyboardist and Jerry Garcia collaborator Merl Saunders.

D.S. Wilson

MetamorphosisBig Splash Music, LLC

Though its release is scheduled for 2025, the title of Chicago-based saxophonist D.S. Wilson’s next album, METAMORPHOSIS perfectly captures the full circle evolution from his roots in jazz through decades of playing and recording rock, pop and blues before emerging as a bona fide Smooth Jazz artist in 2018. Testament to his extraordinary melodies and chart success - as well as spotlighted for being a finalist in the illustrious talent competition on board the Dave Koz Cruise - Wilson’s 2023 album SKYLINE was produced by Adam Hawley and METAMORPHOSIS is being helmed by Steve Oliver and Grammy nominee Jeff Carruthers. The sophomore single, "Telegram" is a feel-good, joyful jazz jam reminiscent of genre staples like Spyro Gyra and The Rippingtons.

Listening Loft : MUST HAVES

Dan Alan Levine

Over The MoonDanAlanLevine.com

Acclaimed TV arranger/orchestrator and Tony Award nominee for the score of the Broadway Musical "Anna Karenina," multi-talented pianist/composer Dan Alan Levine says that “one of the nice things about Smooth Jazz is that it allows the spirit and soul to relax.” It’s joyfully ironic then, that the wondrously inviting, infectious tunes on his stylistically eclectic (and perfectly titled) debut album OVER THE MOON are peppy and optimistic. Advance singles are still receiving airplay around the world on Smooth Jazz radio and being featured on some of the most popular streaming Playlists. Mixed and mastered by chart-topping songsmith Peter Ferencz (Peet Project) and driven by light funk grooves that breeze along the pop, soul, jazz, tropical and Latin landscapes – with a dash of classical. Dan’s emotionally compelling melodies come to life with the support of two genre leading ladies, flutist Kim Scott and saxophonist Jeanette Harris. The latest single, "Sky Skippin'" (radio remix) is a burner with a freshly reimagined and remixed perspective from Hungarian Smooth Jazz producer and hitmaker Peet Ferencz with live drums, bass and guitar!

Arienne hearts Charlie

Big LogWar and Spirit Records

Showcasing a smooth and enticing duo dynamic with a vocalist female and instrumentalist male arrangement that brings to mind adult contemporary icons like Everything But The Girl and Swing Out Sister. Emerging duo Arienne Hearts Charlie celebrates the wonderful notion that collaborating married couples can still be crazy in love. One of a batch of singles that they have released in rapid succession this summer, is a beautiful take on Robert Plant's classic, “Big Log." Refashioned in a laid back, soulfully swaying manner featuring the sly, inviting blend of Charlie’s steel guitar (on both lead melody and solos) and Arienne’s dreamy caressing vocals. The artful 1983 song lyrically touches down on life's comings and goings... A song of restlessness and unrequited longing with reference to the open road and introspection. Get ready for lots more to come from this clever musical duo, "Big Log" is only the beginning!

Patrick Bradley

Road Trippin'Patricks Song Factory

Just in time for spring and summer travel plans, veteran pianist/composer Patrick Bradley creates the ultimate free-spirited, let’s forget about the winter, driving tune with his breezy, high-spirited single, “Road Trippin’," from his forthcoming album GRATITUDE. After years of brilliant hit-making with Jeff Lorber, this instantly engaging track – the follow-up to the post-pandemic EXHALE album – is Bradley’s latest collab with Smooth Jazz saxophonist and producer Darren Rahn, who co-wrote and produced this new tune, which features the unique touches of a Wurlitzer piano. Deeply rooted in the joy of their shared spirituality, the prolific Bradley-Rahn partnership has blessed us with positive, percussive and jazzy, solo-filled tunes that have the power to clear minds, uplift souls and get toes tapping!

Jill Butler

JoyrideJill Butler

It’s listed as a “Fun Fact” on her bio, but when you listen to multi-talented, genre-busting (blues, jazz, pop soul) pianist, vocalist and composer/producer Jill Butler’s aptly titled, wildly and adventurous debut JOYRIDE, you’ll know it’s truly her ongoing mission – devoting 100% of her time to uplifting the soul and uniting hearts through music. She brings her fiery and frolicsome, homegrown Louisiana lightning to a slate featuring both shimmering, percussive piano driven originals (including tributes to her professional musician parents and regional legend Carol Fran) and fanciful twists on classics by Stevie Wonder, The Beatles, Charlie Chaplain and New Orleans great Allen Toussaint. While ensembling with a cadre of Louisiana Music Hall of Famers, Butler also spins fascinating flute, vibes and organ sounds on her synth.

The Allen Carman Project

I've ArrivedAllen Carman Music

Five years and six hit singles since releasing their critically acclaimed debut CARMANOLOGY, the title of The Allen Carman Project’s I’VE ARRIVED says it all about the vibrant full-length collection their fans have been longing for. Comprised of those memorable singles and two new freshly funked-out, horn-fired tracks, the set showcases the intricate sonic invention and ever-groovin’ camaraderie between Carman’s hoppin’ bass, Philippe Saisse’s keyboard wizardry and jazzy, high-energy solos and Gumbi Ortiz’s alternately wild and subtle percussive textures. The band’s expansive repertoire features songs for every mood, from laid back romance and breezy mid-tempo coolness to full on Latin party jams. The Project is booking festivals and events across the U.S. in 2024... Don't miss them!

Bob Coate

Love Like Thatbobcoate.com

The first thing you'll see on the website of the keyboardist and multi-instrumentalist Bob Coate is the phrase “Smooth Jazz and Beyond.” More than just clever branding, the slogan captures the stylistically freewheeling artist’s ever-evolving vibe. Easing away from the laid back beachy cool of his earlier singles, his previous two were a festive Latin excursion and an in the pocket, light funk romp with producer Sonix. Continuing not only to move but obliterate the needle of previous expectations, Coate’s upbeat, frolicsome latest single “Love Like That,” finds him blending lighthearted, jazzy piano magic with bluesy organ harmonies over a contemporary, irrepressible groove. In addition to featuring the energetic warm tones of Hungarian saxophonist Peter Herold, the track was produced by Peet Ferencz (Peet Project) and Sandy Shore (SmoothJazz.com) – a remarkable duo that has also produced an ongoing series of star-studded SmoothJazz.com “Songles" and is opening their studios to artist works!

Fahrenheit 702

Gettin' In The Game, Vol. 1Jaz-Zay Soul Recordings

Fahrenheit 702 brings a sultry, high energy and party vibe to their debut GETTING IN THE GAME, Vol. 1! Named for producer/bassist/group founder Greg Radford’s triumphant return to the music industry after a near-decade hiatus, the colorful Las Vegas centric themes and slick ensemble action make it the perfect soundtrack to a winning streak with a frolicsome night on The Strip. The core members of this Smooth Jazz collective include Radford, power vocalist Diane 'Dedae' Patrise' Spann and saxophonist Keith Marlo are complemented by Grammy & Emmy Award winning Singer/Trumpeter Skip Martin, keyboardist Mike Clark, bassist Walter Jones, guitarists Michael Henegan and James 'JD' Davis, plus Ronnie Foster (organ) and John Wedemeyer (guitar) infuse blues excitement into the delirious swirl of urban jazz, Prince-like funk and Brazilian coolness.

Lowell Hopper

Precious MomentsGet Jazzed Records

During his 20-year service in the Air Force, multi-talented guitarist Lowell Hopper started to write and produce his own music while performing and recording with jazz artists in Germany, the Panama Canal and his adopted home state of Florida. One wonders if those lucky folks who heard and worked with him in those days had any inkling that he would one day be one of Smooth Jazz’s most prolific artists who would release 23 albums over 30 years. While Hopper’s 23rd album, PRECIOUS MOMENTS, is laced with funk and soulful fluidity on the his strings – for the most part however, this is an uber romantic mood record, filled with passionate, intimate slow burning and mid-tempo ballads that make a perfect soundtrack to those precious moments we share with loved ones.

James ‘PJ’ Spraggins

Metamorphosisjamespjspraggins.com

In 2023, veteran drummer/producer James 'PJ' Spraggins re-emerged after an eight year hiatus with STICK IT OUT, an innovative funk and ballad filled album that was featured on SiriusXM’s Dave Koz Lounge. Now, true to its core, faith-based message of determination and confidence, the multi-faceted artist teams with longtime friend and Grammy winning producer/keyboardist Phil Davis for his latest single “Metamorphosis.” Featuring Davis’ gorgeous, easy flowing piano melody and load of fascinating synth sounds over Spraggins’ hypnotic drums and electronic percussion, it’s a meditative and atmospheric tune that seems expressly designed to help people “chillax” and contemplate the mysterious way life evolves as we live it. Even the extra stuff on this tune is alluring, including the song's pastel butterfly cover art and the Spotify Canvas video displaying the actual metamorphosis of a caterpillar becoming a butterfly.

Ron King

MosaicKing Sounds Records

After decades as a first call sideman for everyone from Marvin Gaye and Frank Sinatra to Jeff Lorber and David Benoit, Grammy nominated trumpeter/flugelhorn master Ron King knew the perfect guy to collaborate with when he turned his musical creativity towards Smooth Jazz... Guitarist/producer Paul Brown, who told Ron that he needed to write a hit. He’s been doing just that ever since, with numerous charting singles and albums, including his 2023 collection CASCADE, which made the SmoothJazz.com Top 100 Albums of the Year Chart. Laying an inspiring foundation for his upcoming album, King’s latest single “Mosaic” sets the perfect romantic mood, showcasing his supremely silky flugelhorn melody over an easy funk groove, hypnotic guitar and piano harmonies in a dreamy, seductive atmosphere.

Rei Narita

ZephyrStudio Luna Azul

Having released ten multi-faceted singles over the past year showcasing his infectious composing, artful improvisation and scintillating piano playing, Japan’s Smooth Jazz hero Rei Narita makes the experience even more joyful with his thought provoking themes and titles. His latest is an inspiring piece called “Zephyr,” referring to the winds of change guiding us into a new way of life for the times we're living in, known as the "air era." The sweeping piano here is dreamy and graceful, and this new single includes a gently hypnotic, glissando passage in the middle, perhaps a nod to change. The title literally means “gentle breeze” or “west wind,” and while Narita’s musical journey is often upbeat, jazzy and grooving, "Zephyr" smoothly propels our thoughts forward towards a fresh new perspective.

Nils

Feelin' GoodBaja/TSR Records

If any Smooth Jazz great should be FEELIN’ GOOD, it’s super guitarist, composer, and producer Nils, whose accolade-filled two decade run includes having his hit “Pacific Coast Highway” chosen Billboard’s Song of the Decade and Nils himself being named the #1 Smooth Jazz Airplay Artist for 2021 and 2023. FEELIN’ GOOD is the perfect title for an engaging, uplifting album infused with the prolific artist’s trademark sense of adventure, alternating between snappy, crunchy funk-filled jaunts and sly, moody seductions - all wrapped in the colorful, brass-tinged bow of the cool dynamite he brings to an Earth, Wind & Fire classic. Nils builds on the intricacy of his electric guitar with tasty sonic production details and killer performances from an ensemble featuring Mitch Forman (piano) and Johnny Britt (Rhodes, vocals, horns).

Nick Stefanacci

SecretsSweet Lion Music

Nick Stefanacci’s rise in Smooth Jazz has been so quick and steep that it’s hard to believe he was a longtime pop fusion artist who started his career touring with artists like Derek Trucks, Ja Rule and DMC. Three years after dropping his picture-perfect collection, COVER TO COVER, rising Smooth Jazz star Nick Stefanacci launches his new EP SECRETS with a sizzling, high-octane tribute to one of the legends he covered, Michael Jackson, complete with a “Billie Jean”-like bass groove. In addition to two previously released singles (including a seductive holiday tune featuring vocalist Rich Aveo), the set features three mid-tempo jazz/funk ballads (one is also a playful romantic vocal) that showcase the power and soaring passion Stefanacci brings to his ever-evolving artistry.

Ultrablue

New York StoriesSRS Records

John Smatla, leader of the cosmopolitan global fusion collective UltraBlue, has been on a roll, paying homage to jazz legends since successfully re-releasing the group’s self-titled 2006 release last year. He follows the Earl Klugh tribute “Maria in Blue” with a free-spirited, horn-fired tip of the cap to “Herbie” Hancock, the single’s inspiration. The song features Smatla’s absolutely dazzling melodic and improvisational piano excitement, but there’s an even deeper connection with the intense grooves of longtime Hancock drummer, Trevor Lawrence. Another key element is the lyrical playing and fiery solo by New York saxophonist Eric Knight. Smatla worried it wouldn’t live up to its namesake – but once he let go and chose to have fun, the inspiration led him to a burnin’ final product. The song will be included on Ultrablue’s upcoming album NEW YORK STORIES.

Jamie WilliamS.

Tongue TiedJamie WilliamS.

A consummate, globally renowned entertainer, saxophonist Jamie WilliamS. has performed over the past quarter century in Europe, Central and South America and the Far East while also doing gigs with everyone from Gloria Estefan and Ricky Peterson to Jennifer Hudson, Justin Bieber and on the Smooth Jazz side, Kim Waters and Walter Beasley. Considering that Hudson sang a Stevie Wonder classic on his debut album AFTER HOURS, WilliamS. – also a Professor of Music Production at Full Sail University - had a tough act to follow in dropping his long awaited second collection TONGUE TIED. Yet he succeeds spectacularly and eclectically, finding his niche with an awesome array of mood swings, from fiery blues funk and silky cool romance to atmospheric chill and a smoky, emotional mid-tempo urban jazz flow.

Listening Loft : ESSENTIALS

Amandus

Ready To MoveAmandus Records

To draw whimsical inspiration from his pre-music career, German composer/keyboardist Michael AMANDUS Quast has made a thrilling science out of creating his music career, from his tours with 80s icons (Paul Young, Nik Kershaw, Midge Ure) to these past few years as an ever-adventurous rising Smooth Jazz star. His recent chilled hit, “Earth" has in fact been spinning and streaming on radio stations and playlists around the global! On this latest Amandus single, the engaging gem “Ready to Move,” the energetic groovster returns to his signature explosive fire of funk. This single offers an instantly hummable, emotionally charged hook with an inventive intertwining synth/piano and sizzling horn from guest German saxophonist (and amazing soloist) Arno Haas! If you weren't ready to move, you are now!

Steve Baxter

Crusade BlvdSlubba Bub Record

In 2003, the same year Steve Baxter released his debut solo album IN AND OUT, he earned a Grammy nomination for his work on the Jazz Crusaders’ classic RURAL RENEWAL. Over 20 years later, the versatile trombonist – who has toured with Barry Manilow, Ray Charles and The GAP Band and recorded with Justin Timberlake among others – keeps the classic, soul-deep Wayne Henderson vibe a viable, funky and rockin’ force in Smooth Jazz with his latest album CRUSADE BLVD. Baxter showcases his multi-faceted style with a blend of coolly, strutting grooves, inviting, hipster melodies, silky intimacy and two power vocals featuring legendary soul crooner Ellis Hall.

Marius Billgobenson

A Little Bit of HoneyBlue Willow Entertainment

It’s fitting that a portion of the proceeds from the pre-sale of Congolese born, Stockholm based singer-songwriter Marius Bilgobenson’s latest single “A Little Bit of Honey” was donated to the international anti-poverty, social justice organization Global Citizen. The multi-talented artist is a concerned and compassionate musical citizen of the world, committed to bridging cultural divides through his music. Produced by and featuring guitarist Paul Brown – who helmed two tracks on Bilgobenson’s album THE SPIRIT LOVE – the charming and romantic, horn-spiced tune fuses exotic African rhythms and sensibilities with a soulful, urban jazz vibe. The tune features performances by David Garfield, Shane Theriot, Ron King and Freddie Washington. Welcome back Marius... You are a voice for the voiceless!

Black Tie Affair & Dennis van Aarssen

Scenes From a RooftopBTA Music Powered By AOE

If you want to let loose and dance this summer with both abandon and supreme coolness, start moving across the floor to “Scenes from a Rooftop,” a blast of fashionable, horn-fired Latin magic pairing the smooth, urbane croon of 2019 Voice of Holland winner Dennis van Aarssen with Black Tie Affair, a powerful ensemble specializing in the experimentation of fusing classic big band jazz with modern music production. Painting colorful images of a can’t miss party under the stars on a balmy summer night, the irresistible new single blends the sophisticated charms of DvA and BTA’s previous collaborations.

Kimberly Brewer

Tasting SunshineKimberlily

After a star-studded career as a studio and touring vocalist for legends like Earth, Wind & Fire, Julio Iglesias, Stevie Wonder, Vanessa Williams and Boney James, Kimberly Brewer launched her Smooth Jazz career in 2020 with singles featuring Walter Beasley and Maysa. The inspiring spirit of collaboration takes delightful flight on her latest single, the lushly produced, sultry and romantic “Tasting Sunshine,” a passionate duet with legendary Take 6 singer Mark Kibble (who adds classic gospel vocal textures) and a soaring, ever illuminating solo by Gerald Albright. Penned by Brewer, “Tasting Sunshine” was originally recorded by Lynne Fiddmont on her 2018 album POWER OF LOVE.

Uli Brodersen

City LightsLorraine Tracks

Laying a splendid foundation with two lead singles, the fun and bouncy “South of Summer” and the soulful, atmospheric “Coast to Coast,” veteran German jazz guitarist Uli Brodersen completes his dazzling comeback (after a decade away from solo recording) with his new EP City Lights. The longtime creative associate of Smooth Jazz keyboardist Amandus creates a project inspired by the unique energies of his nocturnal drives through the world’s illuminated metropolises. In addition to the previously released tracks, he includes fresh tunes that artfully showcase his masterful fusion of poppin’ melodic string excitement and cool electronic keyboard wizardry. These four magical songs will invite you to feel the energy of bright lights and late nights... Press play and dive into the world's most vibrant cities!

Michael Cates

Newport NightsSonic ReDoubt

Whether he titled it for Newport, RI or Newport Beach, CA, the funked out, soaring fire that saxophonist Michael Cates brings to his latest single “Newport Nights” would make a sure-fire calling card for a slot at festivals in either location. Produced by Grammy-winning songwriter, producer and keyboardist Jon Gilutin and featuring exciting interactions with piano and electric rock guitar, the instantly catchy track emphatically embodies the mission statement Cates puts at the top of his homepage: “Jazz with a Touch of Groove” – and then some! The prolific artist’s 5th single over the past year, “Newport Nights” establishes Cates as a rapidly rising star in Smooth Jazz, shining as bright as the stars in Newport!

Nick Dukas

Talk of the TownCnd Records

Propelled by a super-hip, brassy and enticing finger snapping arrangement, sly optimistic lyrics and a stellar vocal duet with the charming, nimble voiced Tanya Lewis, Clearwater, Florida-based, soulful crooner and songwriter Nick Dukas’ latest single “Talk of the Town” is destined to be a self-fulfilling prophecy. Truly a celebration of his 10-year collaborative relationship with Lewis, the track is a bold, festive, big band-styled extravaganza featuring 12 studio musicians recorded in St. Petersburg, FL and Nashville. An eleven-time Silver Global Music Award winner, Dukas’ recent holiday tune “It’s Christmas Time Again” earned airplay in 75 countries!

Fingermix

Love You RightFingermix

David Sanborn’s passing in May was a tragic blow to the contemporary jazz community, and it was only a matter of time before Smooth Jazz artists influenced by him began paying homage. Among the first, and quite brilliantly executed, is “Love You Right,” a super tight, edgy, ultra-emotional jam with spacey synth elements by Birmingham, UK R&B producer and remixer Mark “Fingermix” Smith and fellow Brummie, saxophonist Alvin Davis. The ironic thing about this supremely Sanbornesque track is that the two recorded it a year before the pandemic, and now is the perfect time to share it!

Skii Harvey

Somethin' Bout YouSkiiHarvey.com

Australian born Skii Harvey is a multiple international award-winning singer-songwriter with accolades from the Billboard Music Awards, the UK Songwriting Awards and the Australian Songwriter’s Association. Still, it’s charming to imagine her formative years playing an old upright piano in a converted porch bedroom in her mother’s small semi in Sydney. Compared favorably throughout her nearly two decade recording career to Ella Fitzgerald and Tina Turner, she officially wraps a seven-year chapter she calls the “broken” years with a gem. The follow-up to her heartrending EP WAITING, Harvey’s lilting, tenderly romantic latest single “Somethin’ Bout You,” begins with an indie folk vibe and evolves into a smooth, power ballad with R&B, rock and gospel edges. Stay tuned for this next chapter!

Bryard Huggins

ConfidentialMuse Entertainment

Since dropping his debut album ARTISTIC TOUCH at 17, keyboardist/composer Bryard Huggins has toured internationally with Gladys Knight, earned the respect of everyone from Kirk Whalum to Taylor Swift, mentored many young artists and has become a successful entrepreneur as founder of the music production company and label Muse Entertainment. His exciting, boundless artistry continues full force on his seventh album CONFIDENTIAL! The suspenseful, orchestrated groove intro ushers in a super melodic, high-energy and improvisational set filled with infectious, spirited and boundary busting musical adventures. Deeply influenced by the vibes of Brian Culbertson, Huggins includes collaborations with saxophonist B. Thompson and trumpeter/multi-instrumentalist Michael Van Bodegom-Smith.

Shawn Kingsberry

Unapologetically ShawnShawn Kingsberry

So much more than a multi-talented bassist, composer and producer adept at fusing analog with computer generated sounds, Shawn Kingsberry is a dynamic musical visionary who likens himself and his classic R&B, Smooth Jazz, neo-soul and classic R&B to the character of “Morpheus” in “The Matrix” – masterminding the magic to bring listeners the best of all worlds. His highly anticipated, perfectly titled album UNAPOLOGETICALLY SHAWN is an epic 15-track set featuring his multitude of popular singles since 2021 and a batch of sonically and rhythmically eclectic new gems that includes ultra-hip re-imaginings of classics by Phil Collins, Christopher Cross, Wham! and Karyn White & Babyface.

Abe LaMarca

When God's In The MusicKINGASOUL Entertainment

Building momentum towards his second full-length album IT DEPENDS ON WHO YOU ASK, Cleveland bred jazz/R&B influenced singer Abe LaMarca – A proud alumni member of the “Crown Jewel” of Las Vegas, Santa Fe and The Fat City Horns - brings his trademark “soul survivor” swag to “When God's In the Music,” one of the most uplifting, thought provoking and inspirational Smooth Jazz vocal tunes in years. Applying the “Let Go, Let God” aesthetic to the spirituality of the songwriting process, he brings every ounce of passion to the key lines, “You’re right where you belong... Don’t have to write the melody... Sometimes you just gotta play along.”

Dee Lucas

Tighten UpODL Music

Two years after his Soul Café Radio Indie Soul Awards nomination, 4-time Billboard charting saxophonist Dee Lucas remains steadfast in his aim to create a “Rebirth of Smooth Jazz” (as his mantra goes) with each recording. Currently celebrating two decades since releasing his debut album REMEMBRANCE, he sets the stage for the release of his latest, the aptly titled TWENTY, with this new single, the cheery, infectious “Tighten Up,” which features some of Lucas’ most charming and lyrical soprano playing and adventurous soloing ever-riding over a bright and bubbly mid-tempo groove.

Cord Martin

Urban RenaissanceCord Martin Music

Released amid a flurry of fresh, funky and sensual singles these past few years, saxophonist Cord Martin needs only his emphatic, melodic horn energy, plenty of blues/gospel intensity and a relentless groove to state his intention for his burgeoning Smooth Jazz career – an inspiring and power-packed “Urban Renaissance.” The Tennessee native’s emergence as an artist complements an already thriving multi-faceted career as an educator, conductor of youth ensembles, and sideman for a wide range of artists from a multitude of genres – including Aretha Franklin, Rick Braun, Jeff Coffin, Tom Harrell, Lee Konitz, Ben Tankard and The Cab Calloway Orchestra.

Bruce McKenzie

I'm Back (Remix)B-Love Entertainment

Talk about a Renaissance man! An Air Force veteran who served the U.S. for 30 years, Bruce McKenzie is currently on track to obtain a Doctor of Philosophy, General Psychology – Industrial/Organizational Psychology. He’s also an exceptional veteran guitarist whose nearly half century of playing includes five Smooth Jazz albums and a flurry of recent comeback singles. McKenzie’s latest, a feisty, high energy synth-fired remix of his 2022 track “I’m Back,” is an explosive showcase for his melodic, crackling rhythm guitar and lead electric guitar, which builds to a truly explosive ending.

Bryan Morris

Can't BelieveBMoProductions

While he’s played with legends like Maynard Ferguson and blues master Kenny Neal and formed his own popular blues band The Truth featuring Cat Rhodes, veteran drummer Bryan Morris popped into the Smooth Jazz universe for the first time last year as co-composer and performer on Roman Street’s popular 2023 single “Key to Paradise.” The multi-talented artist’s aptly titled debut EP, CAN'T BELIEVE showcases his exciting diversity and ability to inspire a wide range of moods. It includes a hypnotic chill tune featuring silky sax and excitingly edgy electric guitar, atmospheric electronica with intoxicating grooves and a brassy, discofied vocal jam featuring Ms. Rhodes on vocals. Mr. Morris is one to watch for fresh musical ideas and exciting grooves.

Nex Lev'l Band

Purple PassionNl Productions

With each successive recording full of catchy and uber-melodic, urban-tinged Smooth Jazz delights, the Next Lev’l Band continues living up to its uniquely challenging moniker. Launched by drummer Morris Harris, bassist Ernest Raheem and keyboardist Grant Nicholas, the popular Baltimore based ensemble infuses PURPLE PASSION – their first collection in four years – with a potent mix of lead instrumental voices. They complement the elegant and funky piano of Nicholas with crisp, edgy spotlights for electric guitar, and, most prominently, the soaring sax energy of guest Eddie Baccus, Jr. – all topped at special moments by silky, soulful female backing vocals.

Lori Nicely

Reach Into My HeartNicely Music

Anyone who thought veteran composer/pianist Lori Nicely’s transcendent Smooth Jazz disco jam “Faithfully Ladonna Tribute To Donna Summer” would be tough to top should take a listen to her remarkable high-concept new single “Reach Into My Heart.” Featuring Nicely’s elegant, sparkling piano flow and Eric Knight’s powerful sax throughout, the super passionate, heart-tugging and vocal harmony laden ballad is touted as Selina Albright’s “first duet ever,” but the towering vocals of Abe LaMarca are equally responsible for making this a Smooth Jazz vocal ballad for the ages. It's the contemporary equivalent of Roberta Flack’s glorious duets with Donny Hathaway and Peabo Bryson!

Tanya Nolan

Like WaterArtsessionsZ

Going down easy like a stream of refreshing neo-soul/jazz cool on a sizzling summer day, singer/songwriter Tanya Nolan’s beautifully seductive new single “Like Water” marks her latest songwriting collaboration and vocal duet with three-time Grammy nominated R&B star Raheem DeVaughn. Their previous successful singles include “Let’s Celebrate,” “Pace Yourself” and “Honey.” Though she’s an incredibly intimate and emotional R&B/urban jazz singer, music’s just the foundation of this Renaissance woman’s portfolio. She’s also a passionate LGBTQIA+ activist and accomplished entrepreneur with two successful Texas-based daycare centers, a management company for her multiple rental properties and her own independent record label ArtsessionZ.

Jessie Laine Powell

My Love JourneyJLP Music Global

There’s no better way for multiple award-winning singer/songwriter Jessie Laine Powell to prepare her fans for her brand-new second album MY LOVE JOURNEY than letting us know, via the title of her latest single, that we’re in for “Something Special.” Complementing her soulful, grace-filled vocals with hypnotic piano and synth magic and finger-snap percussion, she offers an intimate invitation into the promising early stages of a budding romance. When she’s not singing, the Lexington, KY artist also shares her special gifts via her two arts related mentorship organizations, Dream Manifestor and M.U.S.E. (Motivated Understanding of Self Emerging). A woman of many talents, including sliding right into the pocket of Smooth Jazz vocals!

Michael Ross

No Hugs For YouMIHI Records, Inc.

In addition to an eclectic discography as a vocalist and instrumentalist that reaches back to 1991, singer, guitarist and all-around musical hyphenate Michael Ross was a staff guitarist at Chicago’s Schubert Theatre, and has played in musical theatre touring companies and performed with everyone from Ramsey Lewis and Ronnie Laws to Wayne Newton and Jimmy McGriff. His latest single, “No Hugs for You” lyrically levels the playing field for those who may be challenged by kindness, while musically it engages the senses like an irresistible summer breeze with a sultry sax showcase for his soulful, laid-back vocal style, which will remind listeners of Al Jarreau with a bit of George Benson included on a gorgeous scat outro!

Evelyn Rubio

TouchProductions On Seaspeed Llc

From portraying Mary Magdalene in a Canadian production of Jesus Christ Superstar to portraying Morticia Addams onstage, Mexican born saxophonist, songwriter and vocalist Evelyn Rubio has always found dynamic ways to make her mark – so much so that both her likeness and horn have been inducted into the Women Songwriters Hall of Fame Museum. Continuing to showcase her array of talents in fresh and unexpected ways, she follows her fiery, pop/R&B vocal single “Because I Want To” with a moody, seductive slow burning power ballad arrangement of John Klemmer’s 70’s jazz fusion classic “Touch” that showcases the many shades of her ever-deepening artistry.

Ronny Smith

StruttinPacific Coast Jazz

Right in line with chart-topping, Smooth Jazz guitarists the likes of Norman Brown and the late great Nick Colionne, multi-talented guitar hero Ronny Smith – a 35-year veteran of U.S. Army bands - has been working his fluid and melodic, Wes Montgomery/George Benson-influenced string magic for over 20 years. His latest, perfectly titled album STRUTTIN is a picture perfect collection of playfully grooving and burning smooth tunes from start to finish. Infused with exciting brass energy, sly and sultry ballads, and a soulful re-imagining of a Great American Songbook classic as well as a snappy personal homage to the Montgomery aesthetic on a whimsical, exotic twist of a familiar Wes chestnut.

Sharmond Smith

You're the OneSharmond Smith Music Company

Well known for his lengthy associations with fellow Bahamian musicians King Eric Gibson and Ronnie Butler, saxophonist/flutist Sharmond Smith’s multi-faceted career includes heading his own entertainment company and making his mark on Smooth Jazz with two albums and a few holiday releases. His latest single “You’re the One” is a sultry, silky ballad featuring his cool sax weaving around the powerfully poignant and emotional vocals of Akia Knowles, a popular Bahama-based international performer. The song’s narrative carries a pointed message about a woman discovering her true worth after leaving a bad relationship... While many women can tell this story, few can deliver it with the power of Akia!

Daniela Soledade

Moody's Mood For LoveCopanema Records

Continuing to carry forward the legacy of her songwriter grandfather Paulo Soledade and musician father Paulinho Soledade – both powerful figures in the ongoing history of Brazilian music - Daniela Soledade was quickly hailed as the “new sound of Bossa Nova” upon the release of her 2019 debut album A MOMENT OF YOU. With the release of her silky and dreamy yet playfully adventurous, slightly bluesy twist on the classic “Moody’s Mood for Love,” the supple voiced Brazilian born, U.S. based singer shows that her multitude of charms extends beyond her “home genre” and into a true mastery of jazzy, wit-filled storytelling and exciting vocal improvisation.

Sonix

BroadwayNucleus Entertainment

Having topped the Smooth Jazz charts with his 2022 album LOVE CRUSADE, Tim “Sonix” Rouse – a veteran keyboardist composer who has worked with David Bowie, Barry White, DMC, Maxi Priest and Travis Barker – continues to whet our appetite for his upcoming follow-up collection LOVE CRUSADE 2.0. Following the triumphant “Victory,” the inventive artist weaves a hypnotic spell on the second lead single “Broadway” via neo-soul flavored verses and an intoxicating, adventurous synth/brass hook. He presents the uplifting, emphatic tribute to the summertime vibes of his native NYC with two versions, the second featuring the wild, incendiary soloing of sax prodigy William Prince.

Debbie Spring

Have I Got A Deal For YOU Cr Records

Contemporary and Smooth Jazz have had their share of top violinists... Inspired by the great Jean-Luc Ponty, Debbie Spring brings a whole new sensual, intoxicating vibe to the genre via her five-string viola. After decades of playing with everyone from The Mavericks to Miami Sound Machine and Shakira, the illustrious veteran musician follows her 2023 breakthrough album TOCAMOS with the title track to her forthcoming album, HAVE I GOT A DEAL FOR YOU. The full album is a stylistically adventurous, genre-busting set that taps into the loves of her musical life, including bouncy, Latin-tinged horn jams, lush, romantic ballads, soaring orchestral pieces and a trippy, and tasty spin on a Seal classic, "Kiss from a Rose," which is the 2nd single from the forthcoming album!

J Staton

WeekendNext Paradigm

After vibing with super producer Jeff Lorber on his 2022 single “Kickin’ It,” fast emerging saxophonist J Staton turned to an equally versatile and talented veteran to pen and produce his first Paradigm Music track, the passionate, high powered and whimsical romp “Weekend.” Bassist and multi-instrumentalist Jacob Webb writes the perfect tune and creates an optimal sonic environment to showcase both Staton’s silky romantic charm and emotion-filled intensity. After one of Staton’s punchy solos, Webb chimes in and ups the funk quotient with a snappy electric bass solo. This exciting “Weekend” is one you’re gonna want to make plans for!

The Eric Evans Project

Water SoundSoundtracks To Life

Since its 2010 debut with WAVES OF GRACE, The Eric Evans Project has captivated global audiences with a unique blend of contemporary jazz. A decade later, after years of fruitful collaboration, Eric Evans and David Eugene Ivey founded "Soundtracks to Life," a music and media arts publishing company. Evans expertly handles various instruments and composition roles, infusing his touch into every project. His live performances enchant Smooth Jazz enthusiasts with vibrant flutes, alto sax, and EWI. Evans began working with chart toping guitarist Adam Hawley on recent releases, with “Water Sound” as their latest. Delivering a dreamy, swaying piece enriched with lush sonic textures, transitioning seamlessly from relaxed and laid-back to soaring to a deeply emotional track. Dive into the musical waves of "Water Sound" and let it carry you to your own personal oasis.

The RT Project

Sunshine LoverThe RT Project

In their 25 years as leaders of the popular, constantly performing and touring jazz/funk ensemble Urban Jazz Coalition, bassist Phil Raney and guitarist Duane Tribune enjoyed performing countless times with Marion Meadows. They stir up some fresh summery magic reuniting with the veteran saxophonist on “Sunshine Lover,” the vibrant second single from their offshoot group The RT Project. On the shimmering, light funk tune the trio fuse their talents over an infectiously hypnotic percussion pattern, with Meadows’ trademark soaring soprano melody, improvising over Raney’s effervescent coolness and Tribune’s slick, darkly melodic tones and crisp rhythmic flow.

Jayson Tipp

Table For OneMind in Overdrive

It’s been a banner year for Jayson Tipp! The veteran keyboardist/composer celebrated 30 years since founding his popular “rough jazz” fusion band Under the Lake – which has been on a prolific creative roll since releasing a comeback album in 2018. 2023 also found Tipp releasing two hit airplay singles (one produced by Darren Rahn, the other by Adam Hawley) which laid a promising, momentum-filled foundation for the drop of his long-awaited Smooth Jazz debut album TABLE FOR ONE. Driven by his summery, upbeat grooves galore and a tasty mix of various keyboard sounds (including organ) with his lively, romantically inclined, improvisational piano excitement, the engaging collection features impactful guest appearances by saxophonists Quintin Gerard W (from Under the Lake) and Greg Vail as well as trumpeter Ilya Serov.

Terence Young

The PlaylistTerence Young Music

Versatile composer/guitarist Terence Young’s perfectly balanced musical life includes ten genre-hopping albums (Smooth Jazz, R&B, gospel, and fusion), plus a resume full of R&B icons, including sharing stages with Gladys Knight, Babyface and Gerald Albright and serving as musical director for Ashford & Simpson, Lenny Williams and Angie Stone. Fully embracing his trademark rhythmically tight, melodically magnificent, stylistically eclectic vibe, Young’s latest album THE PLAYLIST fits into today’s streaming aesthetic, by definition offering something for everyone’s taste –sometimes silky and breezy, often funky urban jazz, silky and romantic pop/soul, ambient new age and explosive rock guitar. Beautifully titled... Beautifully played!
